duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate care, provide crisis intervention, short-term and long-term support, and service coordination for Holocaust survivors.
Enter and access detailed information in database tracking systems.
Implement socialization programs and work on various projects for Holocaust survivors funded by grants.
Meet with clients virtually, at the office, and/or in the field to coordinate appropriate services and provide ongoing support.

Provide culturally and linguistically appropriate support using integrated services, including health & mental health navigation, direct financial assistance, food, and transportation to vulnerable aging Holocaust survivors.

Plan and coordinate social events, assess each client, determine best fit for client within program eligibility requirements, provide on-going care management, attend program-related meetings, and maintain documentation and client records.

Maintain confidentiality and quality in all services with and for clients, provide comprehensive assessments of each client, respond to requests for information, and complete quality assurance measures.
Ensure client records are complete, maintain client confidentiality, and save client thank you notes or emails for reporting purposes.

education_certification.credential: BSW or Bachelor’s degree in gerontology or human services field, MSW or Master's preferred.
